page.title: 20Mrs Paxton Chadwick
page.content: Mrs Lee Chadwick has seen many changes since coming to Leiston in 1937.She came orginally as an English teacher to teach at Summerhill School.She has lived here on the heathland,between Leiston and Sizewell ever since.Her late husband Paxton Chadwick was a well-known designer and illustrator of books on Natural History.He was a leading member of Leiston Town Council. He had a road in Leiston named after him as a tribute to his work for Leiston people.Herself at one time a County councillor on the East Suffolk county Council,Lee Chadwick has in the last twenty years written books on Natural History,including her latest book on In Search of Heathland,She has been one of the leaders in the fight against the siting of the new Power Station at Sizewell.Her objections being based on the damage to flora.
